intro: Mespilodaphne trichophlebia, commonly known as the woolly-leafed mespilodaphne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Mespilodaphne trichophlebia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
